content.description:
When approaching the Visions Wall, the most dramatic arete of this cliff juts out overhead, extending above the tree tops. The route is primarily a sport climb but has some crucial gear between the 4th and 5th bolts.

Start the route by crimping past 4 bolts to a good rest (5.10). The first part of the route is just steep enough to be interesting but the overhanging fun begins after placing a #2 and 3 camalot in the right leaning, juggy crack. Take your time to place good gear as a fall from just below the next bolt could result in a deck fall without the gear. After placing your pieces and grabbing a rest in the "pod", launch up the arete and face just to the right. Around the 8th bolt, either stay on the arete for the full value 5.12 version or climb about 3 feet to the right for the 11d. At the last bolt, move back left as the arete ends at an 18" ledge with a three bolt anchor. This route really shines after the gear placements where you will encounter an unrelenting, overhanging wall with featured rock and mostly positive holds.
content.protection: 11 bolts with a #2 and #3 camalot or equivalent. 3 bolt anchor.
content.location: Vision of Impalement is located on the right side of the main arete, which is the first formation you will come across as the trail hits the crag.

content.description:
awesome limestone corner on trad. pumpy, but never hard.

Would be THE warm up for the Paisano wall if it was bolted!

UK E35c
content.protection: gear is somewhat hard to place as the route isnt well travelled and dusty

content.description: Start at the base of the Visions of Impalement arete and traverse uphill right along the entire base of all the routes on Visions Wall to the no hands rest in the corner on the far right at the base of Paisano Buttress. Weird landing in some places - but long, tricky, pumpy and fun!
content.location: Traverse the base of Vision Wall from left to right.

climbs.name: Survival Of The Fittest
climbs.fa: P. Humphrey, E. Chemello, T. Klawin, S. Clark

content.description: Cool lower section with hidden incuts; middle section is a little junky and slightly runout (but relatively easy); upper section is somewhat thin and deceptively steep.  Pulling out of the hueco/over the bulge seemed to be the crux.  Not as good as the 2 routes to the right, but worth a lap.
content.location: Route to the left of Gooseberry, i.e. second to the left of the big snag against the wall.

content.description: Climb the first 3 bolts of 420 Shadow, traverse left at the flake into the last 3 bolts of Karma-Kazi.  Skips the crux of both routes.  Good for a warm-up at the Visions Wall.
content.protection: 6 bolts, .5 or .75 cam for flake.  Lower-off anchors.

content.description: This was a very R-rated mixed route branching rightward off of Indian Summer that essentially never got any traffic. It was recently retrobolted with permission from Eric and is now a fully bolted masterpiece. At the 10th bolt, veer right, staying in the juggy dihedral. The wall gets steep and the bolts space out. The anchors have been moved higher, adding some more exciting climbing with the potential for some massive [all clean] air time!
content.protection: 13 bolts. Lower off anchors. Long draws help on bolts 10, 11, and 12.
content.location: Start one bolt line right of Visions of Impalement.

content.description: Linkup of 4 routes on the Visions Wall, including Survival Of The Fittest, Gooseberry, Karma-Kazi, and 420 Shadow.  Climb the first 3 bolts of Survival, and head right at the ledge.  Clip the next three bolts on Gooseberry and head right to the flake on Karma-Kazi.  Clip the bolt above the flake, and head right again into the last two bolts of 420.  Includes the low crux on Survival, the power crux on Gooseberry, and the thin crux of 420.  A load of superb 5.11 climbing broken up by 2 good rests.
content.protection: 9 bolts, optional gear (.75 or 1 Camalot for end of 420 Shadow), lower off anchors.

content.description: Low crux up to obvious flake and steep face above.  The crux comes between bolts 1 and 2 and can easily be avoided by going right at the first bolt.  The rest of the route is sustained 5.10+ on good pockets and edges, with a second crux moving past a big pocket at the 6th bolt.
content.location: Just right of the big snag, between 420 Shadow and Gooseberry.

content.description:
Excellent crimpy lower section (5 bolts), to a gear placement, to a juggy but steep headwall.  Last 20' requires gear as well.  Can move left to the final bolt of Visions of Impalement.

Similar to a lot of the routes here, this would climb much better if fully bolted.  The last 20' section of "crack" that requires gear is grungy and fragile...take care with placements.
content.protection: 12 bolts, gear to 2".  Shares anchors with Visions of Impalement.
content.location: First route to the right of Visions of Impalement.

content.description: Start out just downhill from the large tree stump. Climb 10ish terrain for four bolts to a good rest then tackle the crux, moving past a bad left-hand gaston to a small crimp. The climbing stays sustained above.
content.location: Center of Visions Wall, just left of the tree stump.

content.description: Thin edging and crimps on a less-than-vertical wall.
content.location: Far right side of the Visions Wall.  Shares anchors with 420 Shadow.

content.description: Calling all crimping freaks! 420 starts on the large ramp-like feature towards the right side of the Visions Wall. Step up onto the ramp and go straight up past a 2 by 3 foot flake(clip). Crimp up sweet edges interspersed with occasional larger holds. Between the fifth and six bolts the thin holds get thinner and the angle gets steeper before letting up for the sixth clip. A few moves above the sixth bolt you will encounter a fun juggy crack for the last 15 feet to the anchors.
content.location: Look for the large ramp-like feature on the right edge of the Visions Wall. 420 Shadow starts toward the right edge of the ramp.
